item.title: Covariance in one dimension
item.description: Covariance in a single dimension In this and the following posts, we’ll return repeatedly to the case of a univariate random variable, in which case the covariance reduces to the ordinary variance. This will let us test out computations in a simple setting, and will also provide good intuition. In particular, many of the differentio-geometric properties of the covariance have simple interpretations in the one-dimensional case, which are helpful for building intuition for some of the concepts we’ll be discussing without digging too deep into the mathematical concepts themselves.
